io.lovelacetech.server.controller

Class AssetController

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.lovelacetech.server.controller.BaseController
      • io.lovelacetech.server.controller.AssetController

  • @RestController
 @CrossOrigin
 @RequestMapping(value="/api/secure/assets")
public class AssetController
extends BaseController
    The API controller for modifying Asset objects in the database

      • getAssets

        @RequestMapping(value="/",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.asset.AssetListApiResponse getAssets(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                               io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser)
        GET /api/secure/assets/

        Gets all the Assets in the database and returns in a list.

        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": {
     "assets": [Asset]
   }
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be SUPER to access this endpoint.
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser - User
        Returns:
        [Asset]

                                                                                                                                                                      java.util.UUID assetId)
        GET /api/secure/assets/byAssetId/{assetId}

        Gets a single Asset by its ID.

        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": Asset
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        The user must have permissions for this Asset. See AccessUtils for definitions concerning user access.
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser - User
        assetId - UUID
        Returns:
        Asset

      • getAssetsBelongingToDeviceId

        @RequestMapping(value="/belongingToDeviceId/{deviceId}",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.asset.AssetListApiResponse getAssetsBelongingToDeviceId(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                                                io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                                                @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                                java.util.UUID deviceId)
        GET /api/secure/assets/belongingToDeviceId/{deviceId}

        Gets the list of Assets that belong to the Device with id "deviceId". That is to say, the returned Assets all have their homeId set to "deviceId"

        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": {
     "assets": [Asset]
   }
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        The user must have permissions for the Device with id "deviceId". See AccessUtils for definitions concerning user access.
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser - User
        deviceId - UUID
        Returns:
        [Asset]

      • putAssetForAuthenticated

        @RequestMapping(value="/forAuthenticated",
                method=POST)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.asset.AssetApiResponse putAssetForAuthenticated(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                           io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                           @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                           io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiAsset asset)
        POST /api/secure/assets/forAuthenticated

        This endpoint is to CREATE or UPDATE Assets.

        To CREATE an Asset, supply the body in the following manner: 
         {
   (required) "homeId": Device.id,
   (required) "rfid": HexString,
   (optional) "name": String,
   (optional) "status": [AVAILABLE, REPAIR],
   (optional) "locationId": Location.id,
   (optional) "deviceId": Device.id,
   (optional) "type": String        // Ideally, "type" will be on of the Company's existing "AssetType"s
 }


        To UPDATE an Asset, supply the body in the following manner: 
         {
    (required) "id": uuid,
    (optional) "name": String,
    (optional) "status": [AVAILABLE, REPAIR],
    (optional) "homeId": Device.id,
    (optional) "locationId": Location.id,
    (optional) "deviceId": Device.id,
    (optional) "type": String,      // Ideally, "type" will be on of the Company's existing "AssetType"s
 }


        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": Asset
 }


        PERMISSIONS
        The user must have permission for the IDs specified for any of: {homeId, locationId, deviceId}. See AccessUtils for definitions concerning user access
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser - User
        asset - Asset
        Returns:
        Asset

      • deleteAssetById

        @RequestMapping(value="/{assetId}",
                method=DELETE)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.asset.AssetApiResponse deleteAssetById(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                             io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                             @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                             java.util.UUID assetId)
        DELETE /api/secure/assets/{assetId}
        Deletes an Asset by id. Returns the deleted Asset in the response body.

        RESPONSE: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": Asset
 }

        PERMISSIONS:
        The authenticated user must have access to the Asset in order to delete it.
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser - User
        assetId - UUID
        Returns:
        Asset
